28 #ifndef _BGPDUMP_LIB_H
29 #define _BGPDUMP_LIB_H
30 
31 #include <stdio.h>
32 #include <stdbool.h>
33 
34 
35 #include "bgpdump_attr.h"
36 #include "bgpdump_formats.h"
37 
38 #define BGPDUMP_MAX_FILE_LEN 1024
39 #define BGPDUMP_MAX_AS_PATH_LEN 2000
40 
41 // if you include cfile_tools.h, include it first
42 #ifndef _CFILE_TOOLS_DEFINES
43 typedef struct _CFRFILE CFRFILE;
44 #endif
45 
46 typedef struct struct_BGPDUMP {
47  CFRFILE *f;
48  int f_type;
49  int eof;
50  char filename[BGPDUMP_MAX_FILE_LEN];
51  int parsed;
52  int parsed_ok;
53  // corrupted read signals a corrupted entry found in file
54  // when a corrupted read is set eof is 1 and entry is NULL
55  bool corrupted_read;
56  // this object used to be a global variable, now it is part of
57  // BGPDUMP so that multiple BGPDUMP objects can be used simultaneously
58  // without collisions
59  BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_PEER_INDEX_TABLE *table_dump_v2_peer_index_table;
60 } BGPDUMP;
61 
62 /* prototypes */
63 
64 BGPDUMP *bgpdump_open_dump(const char *filename);
65 void bgpdump_close_dump(BGPDUMP *dump);
66 BGPDUMP_ENTRY* bgpdump_read_next(BGPDUMP *dump);
67 void bgpdump_free_mem(BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry);
68 
69 void process_attr_aspath_string(struct aspath *as, int buildstring);
70 
71 char *bgpdump_version(void);
72 
73 #endif
